node.title: De Blasio votes for his successor as he eyes a campaign for governor.
node.alt: Mayor Bill de Blasio, whose second term is coming to an end, cast his ballot in Park Slope on Tuesday.
node.description: By Precious Fondren and Michael Gold
node.content: ["With his time left in office dwindling, Mayor Bill de Blasio cast his ballot in the election for his successor at a busy Park Slope Library on Tuesday, a vote that essentially reinforced the end of his eight-year term even as he appeared to be weighing his political future.", "\u201cI\u2019m feeling good,\u201d Mr. de Blasio told a volunteer after being greeted by a small group of election officials and voters shortly after noon. \u201cThank you for all you\u2019re doing,\u201d he said to more volunteers.", "Mr. de Blasio, a Democrat, did not offer an endorsement in the crowded mayoral primary earlier this year, during which his tenure as mayor became a punching bag for candidates. But he was believed to favor Eric Adams, whom he ultimately backed in the general election.", "Earlier on Tuesday, Mr. de Blasio appeared on MSNBC, where he predicted \u2014 as many have \u2014 that Mr. Adams would sail to victory. \u201cI think he has a real inner strength,\u201d Mr. de Blasio said of his heir apparent, adding, \u201cI\u2019m looking forward to this handoff.\u201d", "After Mr. de Blasio spent several minutes filling in his ballot, he then made his way across the street to Public School 39 to share his thoughts on the race.", "But he stayed tight-lipped about whether and when he would announce a rumored run for governor of New York in next year\u2019s election, saying any announcement would come in \u201cdue time,\u201d even as he has started to tell people privately that he plans to declare his candidacy.", "During his MSNBC appearance, Mr. de Blasio acknowledged that he wanted to \u201ccontinue in public service\u201d and said that he believed there was plenty of work to be done in Albany, the state capital.", "\u201cThis state has fallen behind in some ways that we really must address,\u201d Mr. de Blasio said, before adding, \u201cI look forward to being part of the discussion of where our state needs to go in the future.\u201d"]
